description: The instructions say the toolbar should appear if you move the pointer to the topof the screen but it doesn't. At least this one connects to RDP servers though, unlike the others I tried.
summary: No way back from full screen

description: Unfortunately while connecting to Windows Server 2012R2 character map was way off: arrow keys were numbers and pressing other keys was a literal minefield - unacceptable on a production server...
Due to keyboard mapping issues in Vinagre I am unable to use this program under Fedora 24 to RDP into windows machines. Remmina is a usable alternative.
I only run Debian at home, this really helps me do remote work :)
summary: Let's me connect to work machines from home

description: Fast and clean.  My biggest challenge with it is I can never seem to exit full-screen mode on RDP sessions.  My remote computers have the taskbar at the top.  I'm not sure if that has anything to do with it, but short of killing the app, it doesn't work!
Used nearly everyday.
summary: It works correctly, I am satisfied

description: rdp used to work no prior to 42.2 no longer works.
summary: rdp connectivity does not work under opensuse 42.2

description: It wouldn't get past the unknown certificate screen. I kept hitting Connect, and it just brought up the screen again. Even cancel did nothing. I had to killall -9 the app.

Seems to get stuck in a loop where it asks you to confirm a certificate but pressing either Confirm or Cancel just closes the dialog then re-opens it showing the same information and asking you to confirm or cancel exactly the same thing. This leaves you unable to do anything or get back to the main window and you need to send the vinagre process a sigterm to do anything.

Can't connect to vbox vrde port. stderr shows security negotiation failure.
I'm pretty sure their mailing list is not active, judging by the quality of the software.

I'm using Fedora at home to control my windows machine at work via rdp. It really works great after overcoming a single boundary which has already been reported by others regarding certificate confirmation. As a workaround  I installed the packages 'freerdp' and it's frontend 'rocket-depot' (gnome) and connected to my remote machine once via the latter. A file named 'known_hosts2' is created under /home/$USER/.config/freerdp/ which holds the information needed for authenticatication, e.g. ip, portnum, mac, hash. Afterwards you could even remove these packages  and viangre is happy ever after. Thx a lot for a great piece of work.

Seems to get stuck in a loop where it asks you to confirm a certificate but pressing either Confirm or Cancel just closes the dialog then re-opens it showing the same information and asking you to confirm or cancel exactly the same thing. This leaves you unable to do anything or get back to the main window and you need to send the vinagre process a sigterm to do anything.
Stuck on screen where I was supposed to accept a new certificate.
Keep asking to trust a certificate and you can click connect a thousand times. It will not work.
completely useless for RDP!
SSL loop... Use Remmina instead.
Just stuck in a loop where it asks you to confirm certificate. Unable to close application and exit from loop.
...not too user friendly though. Also you have to kill the app once you want to exit fullscreen.

I use it all the time to remotely connect to my other desktop PC running Windows 7. In order for you to use Vinagre's RDP capabilities make sure that the "freerdp" package is installed on your host system.

List of bugs:
- Can't exit fullscreen mode
- When switching to another application then back to Remote Desktop Viewer, the keyboard will not work
- Can't click cancel when accepting a certificate

For whatever reason the super key is always on when interacting with the remote host. Typing a "D" will show the desktop, for example. This further complicates usage due to a modifier the behavior of clicking in Explorer so that you have to right click for a context.

It could be a configuration issue on my end. I would take to the Internet to find help, but the generic name of this app makes it difficult to find targeted troubleshooting by communities.
summary: Issues with super key and mouse click on Windows Server targets

description: I can't customize the connection, like real full screen, color depth etc. No option to set quality, to get the background of the remote machine.

Program seems to crash or hang up; I have had this happen about 5 times now. 
It also seems to either not connect or see the machine at all.

When connecting to a Windows 10 Enterprise machine, the RDP session is 800x600, and cannot be changed. There is a scale mode, but that just makes it a bit taller, instead of making it a more relevant resolution.
summary: Works for admin connections, doesn't scale Windows GUI

description: Password field has way to small of a field. Definitely won't accept default AWS passwords.
RDP connection isn't good.
Using it with computers in my LAN, and it works like a charm.

It connects to RDP but only shows a black screen.
This has no option for pem file to ssh
good tool for the job

Looks great! Does exactly what I wanted - and it's the simplest thing I've had to install so far on my Pi. It's a bit hard to exit when in full screen mode. So I had to exit from SSH Console and using the Kill Command. Additionally, I look forward to seeing how it will perform when I finally add a GERT VGA Adapter to my Raspberry Pi and switch to 2 screens... Maybe this review could change.
Been using remmina, it works just fine. Wanted to try this, it is not helpful.

description: It is not supporting sound on remote or even loal. As my system(kde-neon) there is no option for sound. But , everything except this works pretty.
Doesn't allow entering a VNC password longer than 8 characters so it's sadly useless to me.

Worked for a couple of days, suddently, when connecting to RDP, it just locks up and stops responding. No log messages, no nothing.. Just halts. Need to look for another RDP app, else i will be forced to boot into Windows.
im using remmia to connect to my macbook over vnc. This works but perfomance is bad. Though id try this but it is unable to authenticate.

First use, tried connecting to a remote server. Failed, but no reasons given and simply brought up connection window again. Further, could not close process normally, had to kill 15 the thing. Unfortunately, it doesn't even have an obvious name in the process list.
I don't know much about VNC protocol, but why max 8 chars in password are allowed in 21st century?

Needs better support for HiDPI display clients, lots of screen flickering even when the windows of this app are behind other windows. Also very slow animation and framerate compared to even basic tigervnc client. Gives weird noises when entering my VNC server's password as if it only wants to accept like, 6 or 7 characters, but then it still accepts and works with my long password anyways... Very unstable feeling, but has potential.

...because on Xubuntu 20.04 LTS I can't exit fullscreen... Top bar do not show itself, only way I fiund is by Ctrl+Esc and run new term (I got simplified keyboard, but it does not change the fact). No options in menu.
Have had issues with other clients such as copy and paste within the remote (not even between host/remote), but not with this one. Very productive with it.

It worked fine from my Debian Bullseye (KDE) PC, I was able to connect to my windows VM's, but, has the same problem the other clients have - I can't send CTRL+ALT+DEL, or CTRL+ALT+END to get the windows shutdown options. I was hoping this one would work, as it shows a "Send CTRL+ALT+DEL" keystroke in the screenshot. alas, the actual application did not have it. 

I do of course have other ways to shutdown my windows VMs, but the CTRL+ALT options are so convenient, not sure why all the rdp clients I've tried seem to be missing these options.
Die Usability dieses Programms ist Katastrophe.

Das Tool ist sehr gut, zumindest als Remotedesktop für Windows. Ich habe es jetzt längere Zeit benutzt und habe keine Probleme feststellen können. Das Einzige, was mich stört ist, dass das Remotepasswort nicht länger als 20 Zeichen sein kann. Daher nur 4 von 5 möglichen Sternen.

Usualmente usaba vinagre para conexiones remotas a equipos windows, solo que con esta versión  Fc25 surgió un inconveniente, no puede pasar la advertencia sobre el certificado de seguridad, al salir el recuadro de si confia en el equipo NO ACEPTA ninguna de las opciones: Cancelar o Conectar.
Es decir no puede conectarse por no pasar la simple confirmación :(

Tuve que usar otro programa REMMINA para aceptar los certificados y solucionar el problema.
Era un excelente programa para escritorios remotos pero desde la ultima actualización de Fedora 25 falla, tuve que usar otro programa para poder trabajar como antes.

Более гармонично вписывается в интерфейс гнома. И переключение окон, как будто рабочий стол интергирован в систему.

1. Невозможно вызвать панель управления при задании разрешения, соответствующего монитору: окно разворачивается на полный экран и всё.
2. Западает клавиша Alt. Т.е. когда переключаешься на другое окно в Gnome по Alt+Tab (а по-другому не получается, см. п.1), а потом переключаешься назад, нужно нажать Alt чтобы что-то работало, причём именно тот, который был использован при переключении.
3. Нет передачи файлов.
не работает переключение рус-англ раскладки на удаленном компьютере.
смена раскладки не работает, сочетание клавиш не пробрасываеться
